definition: to flee at the mere sight of (idiom)
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

sentences.english: A bad credence, the likelihood makes you all client flee at the mere sight of the oncoming force .
sentences.chinese: 一個不好的信用，可能讓你所有客戶望風而逃。
